description: The Pricing Summary Report Query provides a summary pricing report for all lineitems shipped before 1998-09-02. The query lists totals for quantity
column8: and average discount. These aggregates are grouped by RETURNFLAG and LINESTATUS
column9: and listed in ascending order of RETURNFLAG and LINESTATUS. A count of the number of lineitems in each group is included.

description: The Minimum Cost Supplier Query finds
column4: for each part of a BRASS type and size of 15
column5: the supplier who can supply it at minimum cost. If several suppliers in that EUROPE offers the BRASS part and size of 15 at the same (minimum) cost
column6: the query lists the suppliers with the order by account balance in descending order
column9: part key in ascending order. For each supplier
column10: the query lists the supplier's account balance
column11: name and nation; the part's number and manufacturer; the supplier's address

description: The Shipping Priority Query retrieves the shipping priority and potential revenue
column3: defined as the sum of l_extendedprice * (1-l_discount)
column4: of the orders having the largest revenue among those that had not been shipped as of a given date of 1995-03-15 and where market segment is BUILDING. Orders are listed in decreasing order of revenue.

description: The Order Priority Checking Query counts the number of orders ordered between 1993-07-01 and 1993-10-01 in which at least one lineitem was received by the customer later than its committed date. The query lists the count of such orders for each order priority sorted in ascending priority order.

The Local Supplier Volume Query lists for each nation in ASIA region the revenue volume that resulted from lineitem transactions in which the customer ordering parts and the supplier filling them were both within ASIA. The query is run in order to determine whether to institute local distribution centers in ASIA. The query considers only parts ordered between 1990-01-01 and 1995-01-01. The query displays the nations and revenue volume in descending order by revenue. Revenue volume for all qualifying lineitems in a particular nation is defined as sum(l_extendedprice * (1 - l_discount)).

The Forecasting Revenue Change Query considers all the lineitems shipped between 1994-01-01 and 1995-01-01 with discounts between .06 - 0.01 and .06 + 0.01. The query lists the amount by which the total revenue would have increased if these discounts had been eliminated for lineitems with l_quantity less than 24. Note that the potential revenue increase is equal to the sum of [l_extendedprice * l_discount] for all lineitems with discounts and quantities in the qualifying range.
The Volume Shipping Query finds
column3: for two given nations which are INDIA and JAPAN
column4: the gross discounted revenues derived from lineitems in which parts were shipped from a supplier in either nation to a customer in the other nation during 1995 and 1996. The query lists the supplier nation
column7: and the revenue from shipments that took place in that year. The query orders the answer by Supplier nation

description: This query determines how the market share of INDA within ASIA has changed over two years for SMALL PLATED COPPER.
column3: The market share for INDA within ASIA is defined as the fraction of the revenue
column5: from the products of SMALL PLATED COPPER in ASIA that was supplied by suppliers from INDIA. The query determines this for the years 1995 and 1996 presented in this order.

description: This query determines how much profit is made on a given line of parts
column3: broken out by supplier nation and year.
column4: The Product Type Profit Measure Query finds
column5: for each nation and each year
column6: the profit for all parts ordered in that year that contain a specified dim in their names and that were filled by a supplier in that nation. The profit is defined as the sum of [(l_extendedprice*(1-l_discount)) - (ps_supplycost * l_quantity)] for all lineitems describing parts in the specified line. The query lists the nations in ascending alphabetical order and
column8: the year and profit in descending order by year (most recent first).

description: The query identifies customers who might be having problems with the parts that are shipped to them.
column3: The Returned Item Reporting Query finds the customers
column4: in terms of their effect on lost revenue betwen  1993-10-01 and 1994-01-01
column5: who have returned parts. The query considers only parts that were ordered in the specified quarter. The query lists the customer's name
column10: comment information and revenue lost. The customers are listed in descending order of lost revenue
column12: customer name and customer account balance. Revenue lost is defined as sum(l_extendedprice*(1-l_discount)) for all qualifying lineitems.

description: This query finds the most important subset of suppliers' stock in GERMANY.
column3: The Important Stock Identification Query finds
column4: from scanning the available stock of suppliers in GERMANY
column5: all the parts that represent a significant percentage of the total value of all available parts. The query displays the part number and the value of those parts in descending order of value.

description: This query determines whether selecting less expensive modes of shipping is negatively affecting the critical-priority orders by causing more parts to be received by customers after the committed date.
column3: The Shipping Modes and Order Priority Query counts
column4: by ship mode which is MAIL and SHIP
column5: for lineitems actually received by customers between 1994-01-01 and 1995-01-01 which is the receipt date
column6: the number of lineitems belonging to orders for which the l_receiptdate exceeds the l_commitdate for two different specified ship modes. Only lineitems that were actually shipped before the l_commitdate are considered. The late lineitems are partitioned into two groups
column7: those with priority URGENT or HIGH
column8: and those with a priority other than URGENT or HIGH.

description: This query seeks relationships between customers and the size of their orders.
column3: This query determines the distribution of customers by the number of orders they have made
column4: including customers who have no record of orders
column5: past or present. It counts and reports how many customers have no orders
column9: etc. A check is made to ensure that the orders counted do not fall into pending deposits. Special categories are identified in the order comment column by looking for a particular pattern(XXXX).

description: This query monitors the market response to a promotion such as TV advertisements or a special campaign.
column3: The Promotion Effect Query determines what percentage of the revenue between 1995-09-01 and 1995-10-01 and "1995-09-01 and 1995-10-01" was derived from promotional parts. The query considers only parts actually shipped  and gives the percentage. Revenue is defined as (l_extendedprice * (1-l_discount)).

description: This query determines the top supplier so it can be rewarded
column5: The Top Supplier Query finds the supplier who contributed the most to the overall revenue for parts shipped between 1996-01-01 and 1996-04-01. In case of a tie
column6: the query lists all suppliers whose contribution was equal to the maximum

description: This query finds out how many suppliers can supply parts with given attributes. It might be used
column4: to determine whether there is a sufficient number of suppliers for heavily ordered parts.
column5: The Parts/Supplier Relationship Query counts the number of suppliers who can supply parts that satisfy a particular customer's requirements which does not have a brand id of 45. The customer is interested in parts of eight different sizes which are one of 49
column13: as long as they are not of MEDIUM POLISHED
column15: and not from a supplier who has had complaints registered at the Better Business Bureau. Results must be presented in descending count and ascending brand

description: This query determines how much average yearly revenue would be lost if orders were no longer filled for small quantities of certain parts. This may reduce overhead expenses by concentrating sales on larger shipments.
column3: The Small-Quantity-Order Revenue Query considers parts of a brand 23 and with MED BAG and determines the average lineitem quantity of such parts ordered for all orders (past and pending) in the 7-year database. What would be the average yearly gross (undiscounted) loss in revenue if orders for these parts with a quantity of less than 20% of this average were no longer taken?

description: The Large Volume Customer Query ranks customers based on their having placed a large quantity order. Large quantity orders are defined as those orders whose total quantity is above a certain level.
column3: The Large Volume Customer Query finds a list of the customers who have ever placed quantity orders larger than 300. The query lists the customer name
column6: date and total price and the quantity for the order.

description: The Discounted Revenue query finds the gross discounted revenue for all orders for three different types of parts. Parts are selected based on the combination of specific brands
column4: and a range of sizes. The first type has a brand id of 12
column8: quantity which is greater than or eqaul to 1 and less than or equal to 11
column9: size between 1 and 5. The second type has a brand id of 23
column14: quantity which is greater than or eqaul to 10 and less than or equal to 20
column15: size between 1 and 10. The third type has a brand id of 34
column20: quantity which is greater than or eqaul to 20 and less than or equal to 30

query_id: All should be shipped by air whose SHIPMODE is either 'AIR' or 'AIR REG' and delivered in person.

description: The Potential Part Promotion query identifies suppliers who have an excess of a forest part; an excess is defined to be more than 50% of the parts like the forest part that the supplier shipped between 1994-01-01 and 1995-01-01 for CANADA. Only parts whose names share a certain naming convention are considered.
The Suppliers Who Kept Orders Waiting query identifies suppliers
column3: for a nation which is SAUDI ARABIA
column4: whose product was part of a multi-supplier order (with current status of 'F') where they were the only supplier who failed to meet the committed delivery date.

description: The Global Sales Opportunity Query identifies geographies where there are customers who may be likely to make a purchase. This query counts how many customers within a specific range of country codes have not placed orders for 7 years whose average account balance is greater than 0.00. It also reflects the magnitude of that balance. Country code is defined as the first two characters of c_phone which should be one of '20'
